title: Ecosystems and Food Webs

vocab.definition: All the living and nonliving things in an environment and how they interact
A diagram showing how energy flows through multiple food chains in an ecosystem
An organism that makes its own food, usually through photosynthesis
An organism that breaks down dead plants and animals
An organism that gets energy by eating other organisms
A consumer that eats only plants
A consumer that eats only animals
A consumer that eats both plants and animals
A consumer that eats producers (often herbivores)
A consumer that eats primary consumers
An animal that hunts and eats other animals
An animal that is hunted and eaten by a predator
A step in a food chain or web that shows feeding position

teachingNotes: Use diagrams to show energy flow. Discuss human impact on ecosystems. Connect to local environments students know.

sample.question: What would happen to an ecosystem if all the producers disappeared?
Why are producers the base of food webs?
Give an example of a primary consumer.
Give an example of a secondary consumer.
How can removing one species affect others?

truefalse.question: Energy flows from producers to consumers.
A food web is simpler than a food chain.
Producers use energy from sunlight to make food.
Removing one species can impact many others.
Producers depend on decomposers for nutrients.
Energy in ecosystems comes mainly from the sun.

multiplechoice.question: In a forest ecosystem, which organism is a primary consumer?
Which best describes a food web?
If producers decrease, then consumers likely:
Which statement is true?
choices: energy flows from consumers to producers
energy flows from producers to consumers

multiplechoice.question: Which organism could be at the top of a food web?
Which adds nutrients back to soil?
What is a primary source of energy for most ecosystems?

fillintheblank.question: The _____ level of a food web contains organisms that make their own food.
Organisms that eat plants are called ________.
Organisms that eat other animals are ________.
Organisms that eat both plants and animals are ________.
A network of food chains is a food ________.
Dead matter is broken down by ________.
Energy for producers comes from the ________.
A rabbit eating grass is a ________ consumer.
A hawk eating a rabbit is a ________ consumer.
Nutrients return to soil thanks to ________.

shortanswer.question: Explain why food webs are more realistic than simple food chains.
What might happen if decomposers disappeared?
How might removing a top predator affect a food web?
Give one example of human impact on a food web.
Why are producers essential in ecosystems?
What happens if a disease kills many producers?
Give an example of an omnivore and its foods.
How do seasonal changes affect food webs?
Explain energy flow direction in food webs.
